item.title: Parts list for the ARM cluster
item.description: ARM Cluster Parts List Realized I forgot to include a parts list for the cluster. Three Odroid HC2 ARM SBCs. Three Power adapters and power cords for them (They’re sold separately) Three microSD cards - I used some I had already - they’re cheap, so get at least 32GB though 16GB works too. One 8 port Ubiquiti UniFi Switch 8 60W (US-8-60W), though really any gigabit switch will do.

item.title: Getting an ARM kubernetes cluster up and running
item.description: Background I recently decided to set up a Kubernetes cluster in my basement, partly because I’d never set a cluster up from scratch by myself, and partly because my existing NAS was beginning to run out of headroom. For a variety of reasons, I decided to use ODROID HC2 boards. They’ve got gigabit ethernet, eight CPU cores, 2 GB RAM and a SATA-3 port for directly connecting a hard drive.

I’m an SRE in Denver. I like cooking, photography, and working on distributed infrastructure. I’m the organizer for Denver CoffeeOps, which currently meets every Thursday morning from 8am to 10am at the Monk and Mongoose in Greenwood Village near DTC. I have a variety of DevOps (and DevOOPs) themed swag on redbubble, if you’d like to buy something and contribute to my hardware habit, or you can contribute at https://www.patreon.com/unixorn.
Email me at jpb @ unixorn.net. I’m curiousbiped on twitter, unixorn on redbubble and apeseekingknowledge on instagram.
